title: Philosophy_4_texts_concerning_(the_evolution_of)_human_conscious
description: Since Galileo's scandalous suggestion that things were not what they seem, and ideas were worth testing, western societies have undergone a 'scientific revolution' concerning  knowledge, evolution, and human consciousness.  Kant layed the cornerstones for an understanding of knowledge and reasoning. Subsequent thinkers have further insights into these weighty matters. Elizabeth Grosz's commentary on Darwin, Dennett and Jayne's makes great reading!
